content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Sussex

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Sussex
fields.bodyText: Big year for Yasir Arafat He will have to take up all of the slack as attack-leader now Mushtaq Ahmed has retired In a nutshell Mike Yardy steps into Chris Adams' shoes as captain, and unlike Adams he won't have Mushtaq to call on. With a new chief executive and chairman also in place, it may be a season for rebuilding rather than winning Ashes factor Matt Prior is England's first-choice wicketkeeper and Sussex will only see much of him if his form slumps. Sussex also have a three-day game against the tourists before the first Test Foreign flavour Murray Goodwin is a familiar face but Corey Collymore and Dwayne Smith opted out of playing for the West Indies to take up places, while Pepler Sandri is a South African with an Italian passport Well I never The club have signed Joe Gatting, Mike's nephew, after he gave up on a football career having been loaned from Brighton & Hove Albion reserves to Bognor Regis Town Andy Bull Bob Willis's verdict Finding a replacement for such an influential spin bowler as Mushtaq will be difficult. Ed Joyce is a solid signing and Pakistani all-rounder Yasir Arafat can be magical, but they will struggle to stay up Captain Mike Yardy Coach Mark Robinson 2008: Championship 6th (Div 1) Pro 40 1st (Div 1) Friends Provident 5th in South/East group Twenty20 Cup 5th in South group In Ed Joyce (Middx), Pepler Sandri Out Chris Adams (retired), Mushtaq Ahmed (retired) Overseas Yasir Arafat
